testcase.purpose: Check if FileSaver.abort exists
Check if FileSaver.abort method is normal
Check if the Blob append an exist blob, then compare its value with blob.Size which is 4
Check if FileSaver.DONE exists
Check if FileSaver.error exists
Check if FileSaver.INIT exists
Check if FileWriterSync.length attribute is normal
Check if FileSaver.onabort exists
Check if FileSaver.onerror attribute exists
Check if FileSaver.onprogress attribute exists
Check if FileSaver.onwrite attribute exists
Check if FileSaver.onwriteend attribute exists
Check if FileSaver.onwritestart attribute exists
Check if FileWriterSync.position attribute is normal
Check if FileSaver.readyState attribute exists
Check if FileWriterSync.seek method is normal
Check if FileSaver.seek method is normal
Check if FileWriterSync.truncate method is normal
Check if FileWriter.truncate method is normal
Check if FileWriterSync.write method is normal
Check if FileWriter.write method is normal
Check if FileSaver.WRITING exists
Check if Blob constructor must be visible when the script's global object is a Window object
Check if Blob() method set 'text/plain', then compare blob.type is 'text/plain'
Check if the type of const DONE is number
Check if the type of const INIT is number
Check if the type of FileSaver.error is DOMError
Ckeck if the event type of FileSaver.onabort is abort
Check if the value of FileWriter.length attribute is normal
Check if the value of FileWriter.position attribute is normal
Check if BlobBuilder.append method parameter type is ArrayBuffer, then compare blobBuilder.getBlob().Size is 11
Check if BlobBuilder.append() has an argument data which type is ArrayBuffer and the ArraryBuffer has no element,then compare blobBuilder.getBlob().Size is 0
Check if BlobBuilder.append() has an argument data which type is ArrayBuffer and the ArraryBuffer has a null element,then compare blobBuilder.getBlob().Size is 0
Check if BlobBuilder.append() has an argument data which is an empty string,then compare blobBuilder.getBlob().Size is 0
Check if BlobBuilder.append() has two arguments which data is empty string and endings is native,then compare blobBuilder.getBlob().Size is 0
Check if BlobBuilder.append() has two arguments which data is empty string and endings is transparent,then compare blobBuilder.getBlob().Size is 0
Check if BlobBuilder.append() throws an exception when BlobBuilder.append() has no argument
Check if BlobBuilder.append method set null and native, then compare blobBuilder.getBlob().Size is 4
Check if BlobBuilder.append method set null and null, then compare blobBuilder.getBlob().Size is 4
Check if BlobBuilder.append method set null, then compare blobBuilder.getBlob().Size is 0
Check if BlobBuilder.append method set null and transparent, then compare blobBuilder.getBlob().Size is 4
Check if BlobBuilder.append method set string and native, then compare blobBuilder.getBlob().Size is 4
Check if BlobBuilder.append method set string and transparent, then compare blobBuilder.getBlob().Size is 4
Check if user agents create a new BlobBuilder object when the BlobBuilder constructor is invoked
Check if BlobBuilder constructor must be visible when the script's global object is an object implementing the WorkerUtils interface
Check if BlobBuilder.getBlob() has an argument contentType which is an empty string,then compare blobBuilder.getBlob().Size is 0
Check if BlobBuilder.getBlob method not set parameters, then compare blobBuilder.getBlob ().type is empty string
Check if BlobBuilder.getBlob method set null, then compare blobBuilder.getBlob().type is empty string
Check if BlobBuilder.getBlob() will create a Blob object when BlobBuilder.getBlob() is invoked
Check if the type of const WRITING is number
Ckeck if the event type of FileSaver.onprogress is progress
Ckeck if the event type of FileSaver.onwrite is write
Ckeck if the event type of FileSaver.onwriteend is writeend
Ckeck if the event type of FileSaver.onwritestart is writestart
Check if FileWriter.abort method invoked, then FileWriter.onabort() function triggered
Check if FileWriter.abort method type is function
Check if a simple function that writes a text file
Check if FileWriter.length is readonly
Check if FileWriter.length type is number
Check if FileWriter.position is readonly
Check if FileWriter.position attribute is of type number
Check if FileWriter.position is zero when a newly-created FileWriter
Check if FileWriter.seek method set 0point5,then compare fileWriter.position is 0
Check if FileWriter.seek method set empty string, then compare fileWriter.position is 0
Check if FileWriter.seek() throws an exception INVALID_STATE_ERR when a user called seek and readyState was WRITING
Check if FileWriter.seek method set -1, then compare fileWriter.position >= 0
Check if FileWriter.seek method set null, then compare fileWriter.position is 0
Check if FileWriter.position is equal to FileWriter.length when FileWriter.seek() has an argument offset is greater than FileWriter.length
Check if FileWriter.position is equal to FileWriter.length plus offset when FileWriter.seek() has an argument offset is less than zero and FileWriter.length plus offset more than zero
Check if FileWriter.position equal to zero when FileWriter.seek() has an argument offset is less than zero and FileWriter.length plus offset less than zero
Check if FileWriter.seek method is of type function
Check if FileWriter.truncate method set 0.5, then compare fileWriter.length >= 0
Check if FileWriter.truncate method set empty string, then compare fileWriter.length >= 0
Check if FileWriter.truncate() throws an exception INVALID_STATE_ERR when a user called truncate and readyState was WRITING
Check if length must be equal to size when FileWriter.truncate() successful completion
Check if FileWriter.truncate() throws exception when FileWriter.truncate() has no argument
Check if FileWriter.truncate method set null, then compare fileWriter.length is 0
Check if position must be the lesser of size when FileWriter.truncate() successful completion
Check if FileWriter.truncate method set 'test', then compare fileWriter.length >= 0
Check if FileWriter.truncate method is of type function
Check if FileWriter.write() throws an exception INVALID_STATE_ERR when a user called write and readyState was WRITING
Check if FileWriter.write method throws exception with no argument
Check if FileWriter.write method throws exception when the target file is not found
Check if FileWriter.write method throws exception when set null
Check if FileWriter.write method is of type function
Check if FW_FileError.code attribute is readonly
Check if FileError.code attribute is type number
Check if the const FileError.ABORT_ERR is equal 3 in FileWriter module
Check if the type of FileError.ABORT_ERR is number in FileWriter module
Check if the const FileError.ENCODING_ERR is equal 5 in FileWriter module
Check if the type of FileError.ENCODING_ERR is numberin in FileWriter module
Check if the const FileError.INVALID_STATE_ERR is equal 7 in FileWriter module
Check if the type of FileError.INVALID_STATE_ERR is number in FileWriter module
Check if the const FileError.NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR is equal 6 in FileWriter module
Check if the type of FileError.NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR is number in FileWriter module
Check if the const FileError.NOT_FOUND_ERR is equal 1 in FileWriter module
Check if the type of FileError.NOT_FOUND_ERR is number in FileWriter module
Check if the const FileError.NOT_READABLE_ERR is equal 4 in FileWriter module
Check if the type of FileError.NOT_READABLE_ERR is number in FileWriter module
Check if the const FileError.SECURITY_ERR is equal 2 in FileWriter module
Check if the type of FileError.SECURITY_ERR is number in FileWriter module
Check if the const FileError.SYNTAX_ERR is equal 8 in FileWriter module
Check if the type of FileError.SYNTAX_ERR is number in FileWriter module
Check if NOT_FOUND_ERR will be thrown when the directory containing the file to be written could not be found at the time the write was processed in FileWriter module
Check if NOT_FOUND_ERR will be thrown when the file being written may not exist in FileWriter module
